data.architecture: This epic performs Git merge operations using GitHub CLI (gh). Each story merges one PR sequentially to avoid conflicts. The merge order is PR #6 ‚Üí PR #7 ‚Üí PR #8, following chronological creation order. Each PR adds non-overlapping architecture and evaluation JSON files to the .agents/ directory. Dependencies ensure sequential execution: Story 2 depends on Story 1, Story 3 depends on Story 2. This prevents race conditions and ensures clean merge history.

stories.title: Merge PR #6 Flutter Platform Setup to main
stories.description:
Merge Pull Request #6 that contains Flutter platform configuration architecture definitions.

üîß **COMMAND TO EXECUTE:**
```bash
gh pr merge 6 --merge --delete-branch
```

üì¶ **FILES BEING MERGED:**
- .agents/judge/techlead-epic-flutter-platform-setup-evaluation.json
- .agents/techlead/epic-epic-flutter-platform-setup-architecture.json

‚ö†Ô∏è **VERIFICATION:**
1. Run: `gh pr view 6 --json state` - should show 'MERGED'
2. Run: `git pull origin main` - should succeed without conflicts
3. Verify files exist: `ls .agents/techlead/epic-epic-flutter-platform-setup-architecture.json`

üö® **IF MERGE FAILS:**
- Check for conflicts: `gh pr view 6 --json mergeable`
- If conflicts exist, checkout the PR branch, rebase on main, resolve conflicts, push
- Then retry merge
acceptanceCriteria: Given PR #6 is open, When developer executes gh pr merge 6 --merge, Then PR state changes to MERGED

Given PR #6 is merged, When checking main branch, Then files .agents/judge/techlead-epic-flutter-platform-setup-evaluation.json and .agents/techlead/epic-epic-flutter-platform-setup-architecture.json exist
Given merge is complete, When running git status on main, Then no merge conflicts are present
